comments:
Using WTP1.5.2 20061021

1. create a new web project
2. import some tag libraries in a jar (like jstl)
3. create a jsp that uses custom tags
4. close workbench
5. reopen workbench
6. Import a jar into Web-INF/lib
7. Delete the jar
8. Get the following exception (full .log is attached)
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.ProjectDescription.handleElementChanged(ProjectDescription.java:1032)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:120)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:72)

Created an attachment (id=53350)
guards against null classpath entry

The faulty code is making a call to IPackageFragmentRoot#getRawClasspathEntry() and getting back null.  I was expecting a JavaModelException when the resource no longer existed, but depending on what's going on, the build path change notification can arrive first.  In that case it correctly returns a null indicating that the underlying resource is no longer on the build path.
remember to update version IDs the first time you change something for 1.5.3 ... and double check the 2.0 (head) stream to make sure all is well with version numbers.
*** Bug 172362 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
When can we expect this fix to be ported and released into WTP 2.0 codeline?
Unless I'm mistaken, it already is.  Are you still seeing a similar problem in 2.0?
Sorry Nitin.   I was pointed at an older Eclipse environment.   I am now seeing the fix.  Thanks.
